column4: i'm having a problem doing an upgrade with apt-get, and openoffice2 is the problem.  how can i remove open office forcibly?
openoffice.org-l10n-en depends on openoffice.org (>> 1.1.4+1.1.5) | language-support-en; however:
it is a gui for apt-get
i thought the new name was adept.
in breezy it's called adept right?
dpgk-r won't remove that one package because others ned them to run
then it should remove everything that needs it.
when it says other program depend on it
you have to add them to the command line as well
